Title: N/A

reviewText: There is no question that 2012 has been a very horrible and sad year for the music industry. There has been so much sadness with greats like Donna Summer to At Last singer Etta James, all the way to Beastie Boys rapper M.C.A. a.k.a. Adam Yauch to cancer. But out of all of those losses, no loss was as further deviating than the tragic loss of Whitney Houston. Ultimately, her passing changed the way we look at the Grammy awards, and hit unlike any other loss in music for 2012. Whitney set so many moments that shook our hearts, and the world unlike anyone else. She made moments that have sent people shiver down their spines, and the world answered to the strength and symbol of "The Voice." But when her death hit, it hit unlike any other loss in the world. For Whitney Houston fans, the Grammy Awards will always be their 9/11 in loss, and her passing will always be looked at as one of the most dynamic losses in the world. But, there is a tribute to celebrate Whitney Houston as a person, who altered the way we hear, see and listen to music.We Will Always Love You: A Grammy Salute To Whitney Houston is a dedicated and elegant celebration of her lifetime, and her moments that really set the world on fire from her debut performance on The Merv Griffin Show that hit the world in a blaze with Home, to reliving her rendition of The Star Spangled Banner at the 1991 Super Bowl, at a time we were entering The Persian Gulf War. The special really celebrates her and her achievements. The performances from other vary, from Celine Dion who did a brilliant rendition of The Greatest Love Of All, to the upbeat drive from Jennifer Hudson doing I Wanna Dance With Somebody, a well showcased departure from when Jennifer delivered I Will Always Love You at the Grammy Awards, the night after Whitney passed to a intimate and somber world. The special handles well, but the extras feature some of Whitney's most memorable videos from I Will Always Love You, to Saving All My Love for You, to the intimate and beautiful video for 2009's I Look To You which won her the 2010 NAACP Image award for Best Music Video.All in all, We Will Always Love You: A Grammy Salute To Whitney Houston is a great buy for die hard Whitney Houston fans young and old, and a strong second look at whom Whitney Houston was as a singer, for anyone whom thought of Whitney as a joke in the same way everyone looked at Michael Jackson as a pedophile to the day he died in 2009. Whitney Houston really will always be revered as the important female singer of the past 25 years, and she always will in life and loss. While I do wish there could've been some more beautiful moments for her, and some more of her videos here like I Have Nothing and When You Believe, there still is a lot to enjoy. This special was definitely a real joy to watch, and a great buy for anyone whom is new to Whitney Houston, because of the impact of her passing.Price: B-Mastering: BExtras: B 1/2+Overall: B

reviewText: It was a great TV special, but you'd think the DVD would have ran longer? Plus the DVD was in one of those horrible small plastic cases (I prefer the regular amaray cases!). There were some extra Whitney videos as extras, but if you own "Whitney's Greatest Hits" DVD, there's only one new video "I Look To You"....Whitney deserved a better tribute collection....Love You, Nippy!
summary: Good, but nothing exciting as far as extras

Title: N/A

reviewText: We Will Always love you is truly a star studded tribute from start to finish. The show opens with Halle Berry describing Whitney's inspiration to her career and closes with a stirring performance of Count on Me from gospel singers Yolanda Adams and Cece Winans. The show is filled to capacity with breathtaking performances from artists such as Jennifer Hudson, Usher and Celine Dion who's performance of" Saving All My Love For You" is simply breathtaking. The shows duration is one hour and between each memorable performance clips of Whitney herself can be seen describing her affection for life, her love of music and her musical career. Whitney's daughter Bobbi Kristina can be seen in the audience mouthing every iconic word of her legendary mother's songs. I wish the tribute could have been a bit longer but it is simply beautiful, celebrating the life and music of a woman who will truly be missed. We Will Always Love You A Grammy Salute to Whitney Houston is a tribute that should not be missed and true fans will not be able to keep a dry eye throughout the entire show. And as a super Whitney Houston fan not only am I ecstatic that this show is being released but greatly appreciative as well.We will truly always love Whitney Houston and with this beautiful tribute (the first and only officially legit tribute so far) she will truly never be forgotten.
summary: We Will Truely Always Love Whitney!
